newsitem.title: LATVIA: INTERVIEW - HANSA SEES LATVIAN DEBT MARKET PICKING UP.
newsitem.headline: INTERVIEW - HANSA SEES LATVIAN DEBT MARKET PICKING UP.

text.p: The scope of instruments available on Latvia's emerging debt market is set to increase as companies seek to improve their liquidity situation, an analyst said on Thursday.

"There are not too many debt instruments in Latvia now...there is government debt, the overnight market, and Merita Bank's bond issue," Maris Vinklers, head of the money markets unit at Hansabank-Latvija, told Reuters in an interview.
Hansabank-Latvija is part of Estonia's largest bank, Hansapank .
"But we expect to see more becoming available in the future," he added.
"We expect, in the next few months, to see commercial paper and bonds issued by corporates in Latvia," he said.
"The first issue should be out soon...at first, the maturities will only be short-term," he said.
Vinklers said that commercial banks would lead the way but that other corporate issues would probably soon follow.
"This will increase liquidity on the market, which is needed, and also help to attract foreign investment," he said.
Neighbouring Estonia has a relatively active commercial paper market with about 500 million kroons worth issued to date.
Like Latvia, Lithuania has no commercial paper market to speak of.
